summary: Create a website similar to https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ named "tripple host".
architectural_notes: Add authenticated admin interface to edit site content and manage pricing plans (create/update/delete), rather than hardcoded-only plans.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing/landing website that closely matches the structure, layout, and interactions of the reference site at https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ (same overall page sections, spacing rhythm, component patterns, and any visible hover/scroll animations), but rebrand all naming to “tripple host”.

Ensure all user-facing text content is in English and provide a single, clearly named place in the frontend code to edit the site’s copy (e.g., a content/config object) so the “tripple host” headings, descriptions, and section text can be updated without hunting through many files.

Apply a distinct, coherent visual theme for the “tripple host” site (colors, typography, buttons, cards, backgrounds) and enforce it consistently across all sections; do not use a blue+purple theme unless it is explicitly required by the reference.
Set the app’s page metadata to reflect the new site branding (document title and any visible header/hero branding) as “tripple host”.
Generate and include a simple brand logo and a subtle background/hero graphic for “tripple host” as static assets, and render them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated).

Update the Tripple Host Pricing section to show exactly two plans—Starter and Iron—with the user-provided prices and RAM amounts, using the existing centralized copy config (frontend/src/content/siteCopy.ts) as the single source of truth.
Add an admin access option in the frontend header using Internet Identity login/logout controls, and show an Admin entry point only when the logged-in principal is an admin.
Create an admin UI that allows admins to add, edit, and delete pricing plans, and persist changes via the backend; include basic validation and clear success/error states in English.
Update the landing Pricing section to render pricing plans from backend data (with a safe fallback), keeping the existing card layout and interactions.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a website similar to https://stranger-nodes-55e.caffeine.xyz/ with the name "tripple host".
Add/update the Pricing section on the Tripple Host website with two plans: Starter (80 rs, 2 GB RAM) and Iron (150 rs, 4 GB RAM).
Add an admin access option (authentication + admin UI) so the user can make site changes and manage/add pricing plans.

Implement admin authorization in the Motoko backend using Internet Identity principals, including a bootstrap mechanism to establish the first admin and a way for admins to manage the admin allowlist.
Move pricing plan data to backend-managed state and expose public read access plus admin CRUD operations so pricing plans can be added/updated/removed without editing frontend code.
